intro: Hemigenia incana, commonly known as the silverleaf hemigenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its silvery-gray leaves, which are covered in fine, glandular hairs. It produces small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in spring. Hemigenia incana is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
